intro: Spermacoce longifolia f. glabrata, commonly known as the glabrous spurgecup, is a variant of the species Spermacoce longifolia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptic in shape, with a smooth surface in this particular form. The f. glabrata form is notable for its reduced pubescence, distinguishing it from the typical variety.
